children.name: navigate
Example - subscribe to the "navigate" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "navigate" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when calendar navigates.

children.name: change
Example - subscribe to the "change" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "change" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the selected date is changed.

children.name: view
children.description: Gets an instance of the current view used by the calendar.

children.name: value
Example - sets the value of the widget
Example - gets the value of the widget

children.description: Gets/Sets the value of the calendar.

children.name: navigateUp
children.description: Navigates to the upper view.

children.name: navigateToPast
children.description: Navigates to the past.

children.name: navigateToFuture
children.description: Navigates to the future.

children.name: navigateDown
children.description: Navigates to the lower view.

children.name: navigate
children.description: Navigates to view.

children.name: min
Example - set the min value of the calendar
Example - get the min value of the calendar

children.description: Gets/Sets the min value of the calendar.

children.name: max
Example - set the max value of the calendar
Example - get the max value of the calendar

children.description: Gets/Sets the max value of the calendar.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **Calendar** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the Calendar element from DOM.

children.name: current
children.description: Gets currently focused date.

children.name: value
Example - specify the selected value of the widget

children.description: Specifies the selected date.

children.name: start
Example - specify the initial view, which calendar renders

children.description: Specifies the start view.The following settings are available for the **start** value:

children.name: month.empty
Example - specify an empty cell template as a string

children.description: The template to be used for rendering the cells in the "month" view, which are not in the min/max range. By default, the widget renders an empty string.

children.name: month.content
Example - specify cell template as a string

children.description: The template to be used for rendering the cells in "month" view, which are between the min/max range. By default, the widget renders the value of the corresponding day.

children.name: month
children.description: Templates for the cells rendered in "month" view.

children.name: min
children.description: Specifies the minimum date, which the calendar can show.

children.name: max
children.description: Specifies the maximum date, which the calendar can show.

children.name: format
Example - specify a custom date format

children.description: Specifies the format, which is used to parse value set with value() method.

children.name: footer
Example - specify footer template as a string
Example - specify footer template as a function

children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) which renders the footer. If false, the footer will not be rendered.

children.name: disableDates
Example - use a function to disabled dates
Example - specify an array of dates to be disabled
Example - specify an array of days to be disabled

children.description: An array or function that will be used to determine which dates to be disabled in the calendar.

children.name: depth
Example - set navigation depth of the calendar

children.description: Specifies the navigation depth. The followingsettings are available for the **depth** value:

children.name: dates
Example - specify a list of dates

children.description: Specifies a list of dates, which will be passed to the month template.

children.name: culture
children.description: Specifies the culture info used by the widget.
